description: Students explore poetry and prose from the earliest periods in the development of the English
language and literature -- by Caedmon, the Beowulf poet, Chaucer, Julian of Norwich, Malory,
Spenser, Shakespeare, Lady Mary Wroth, Donne, Milton -- and investigate how literary
conventions and social history interact. From sermons to sonnets, students examine 1000 years
of literary history and ultimately follow the voyage of English from Britain to the Americas.
Prerequisite: Prior or simultaneous study in English 185.
